intro: Eriocaulon phuphanoides, commonly known as the slender flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowering spikes. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils, often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its reproductive structures consist of tiny, inconspicuous flowers that develop into capsule fruits. Eriocaulon phuphanoides plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
